originalText.text:
There are plenty of legendary addresses in New York City, but 15 Central Park West stands out. The ultra-luxury condominium on the corner of West 61st Street and Central Park West has been home to a long list of bankers, celebrities, and assorted bold-faced names, including Goldman Sachs CEO Lloyd Blankfein and Denzel Washington.
15 Central Park West took three years and $950 million to construct. It was an immediate success, ringing up some $2 billion in sales. Even today, the building continues to break real estate sales records.

15 Central Park West took three years and $950 million to construct. It was an immediate success, ringing up some $2 billion in sales. Even today, the building continues to break real estate sales records.

originalText.text: I wish if they allowed me to put zero but in fortunately it's only one star I was there for a couple of days working it's horrible the management which is run by James zaratin i'm just shocked how they hire him to do the job but he  doesn't have a clue to do it if you plan to work in this building be prepared they choose the days and the hours and they look for people who they don't have life so they can control you he allowed painters and engineers and doorman's to run the crew so you have 100 bosses instead of one or two and they give you papers to sign so you cannot take any pictures or to post on Instagram because they're afraid that you're gonna expose them how horrible billding is to work there I work for many years in high end luxury buildings but so far I never see anything like it like in this building horrible when they hire you for one position be prepared they gonna give you to do everything in the building including painting fixing stuff even what is not your job or position they will give it to you to work thank God i  left and if you go in the interview you're going to see the fake smile and smirk because they think when they hire you they own you but never me

originalText.text:
Designed by architect Robert A.M. Stern, this building is one of only a few all-limestone #buildings to join the city's skyline in a 100 years.
At the heart of the building is a meticulously designed 14,000-square-foot Fitness Center and 75-foot lap pool. Illumination of its skylights comes from the serene reflecting pool in the courtyard above

originalText.text: My fiance and I have been living here for the past couple of years. This is our first apartment together and we sure hit the jackpot--we couldn't have made a better choice! I love the location, the Upper West Side is such a lovely neighborhood. We're only steps away from Central Park which I think is great. 15 CPW is comprised of all the luxury, elegance, and high-end quality of NYC living. Our 2BR apartment is so spacious with windows everywhere for awesome views. I enjoy being in the library mostly and my fiance loves the gym. I definitely recommend 15 CPW to anyone seeking a new home in Manhattan!

originalText.text: I love running, so it was almost perfect to me! If you like hard stuff, it may not be the best place to run! but still, the view is amazing and worths it!
